alert.note: Alert for Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 1:02PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, Salmon River near Gustavus and surrounding area. * WHEN...Until 700 AM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in areas around the Salmon River near the gravel pits, Rink Creek and Wilson Road. Minor flooding is expected to begin Thursday afternoon, especially near the Salmon River. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected. - For Salmon River at Gustavus : At 12:15pm the stage was 15.35 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
